oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Johnny Rodriguez
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Johnny Rodriguez (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of August 15, 1988.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Johnny Rodriguez
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Pulsebeat show with Johnny Rodriguez -- (00:44) Spangler praises the album: Gracias; additionally, Rodriguez reveals what caused a delay in its production -- (01:20) I Wanna Wake Up With You (Johnny Rodriguez) -- (04:32) Spangler reflects on Rodriguez's three year hiatus -- (04:43) Rodriguez reflects on recording "Deportee" with Johnny Cash and Willie Nelson -- (05:52) Deportee (Johnny Rodriguez, Willie Nelson, Johnny Cash) -- (09:18) Spangler introduces WWYN and others to the broadcast -- (09:42) Ronald Olson and David Page perform a Hot Stuff Show break about Joe Episcopo and Elvis Presley -- (11:00) Spangler introduces how Rodriguez started his career -- (11:12) Rodriguez reflects on how he had been caught stealing goats -- (12:52) Spangler welcomes back the audience and begins the discussion of where Rodriguez was in his life -- (13:22) Rodriguez reveals how he began his career with Tom T. Hall -- (14:15) I Didn't (Every Chance I Had) (Johnny Rodriguez) -- (17:21) Rodriguez says his biggest regrets was the goat situation -- (17:29) Pass Me By (Johnny Rodriguez) -- (19:45) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (19:59) Spangler asks Rodriguez what song he would like to hear -- (20:17) Sunday Morning Coming Down (Johnny Cash) -- (24:16) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kin; Rodriguez, Johnny;
